com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.exception
Class PathException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          java.io.IOException
              com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.exception.PathException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
@FullyTested
public class PathException
extends IOException

This is a more specific version of IOException that focuses on path-related errors. It applies to both file and directory paths.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:

This is a convenience method for PathException(PathExceptionReason, File, File, String, Throwable) where param optCause is null.

PathException

public PathException(PathExceptionReason reason,
                     File path,
                     File optParentPath,
                     String message,
                     Throwable optCause)
Constructs a new PathException object. These should be thrown instead of IOException in cases where the error is specifically path-related. Some errors are caused by a parent path and others not. This class is careful to distinguish between both cases.

To understand when parent path is not null, consider this example:

  1. Imagine a utility method tries to make a directory...
  2. Where input path is /home/user/abc/def...
  3. But /home/user/abc exists as a file...
  4. After failing to make the directory, the method might throw an exception where:
    1. Parameter reason is PathExceptionReason.PARENT_PATH_IS_NORMAL_FILE
    2. Parameter path is /home/user/abc/def
    3. Parameter optParentPath is /home/user/abc
    4. Parameter message is "Failed to make directory: '/home/user/abc/def'; Parent path is a file: '/home/user/abc'"
    5. Parameter optCause is null

Parameters:
reason - why the error occured. Access via getReason().
path - deepest path that caused the error. Relative paths are converted to absolute paths automatically. Access via getAbsPath().
optParentPath - (optional) parent path that caused the error. If PathExceptionReason.hasParentPath is:
  • true, then this parameter must not be null.
  • false, then this parameter must be null.
Relative paths are converted to absolute paths automatically. Access via getOptAbsParentPath().
optCause - (optional) underlying cause of this exception that is passed directly to the superclass constructor. May be null. Access via Throwable.getMessage().
Throws:
NullPointerException -
  • if reason, message or reason is null
  • if PathExceptionReason.hasParentPath is true and optParentPath is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if message is empty or only whitespace
  • if PathExceptionReason.hasParentPath is false and optParentPath is not null

getOptAbsParentPath

public File getOptAbsParentPath()
Returns:
(optional) absolute parent path that caused this error. Here, optional means: may be null. See PathException(PathExceptionReason, File, File, String) for further notes about when and why this field is null (or not).
